intro: Humularia kapiriensis var. repens, commonly known as the creeping humularia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, fragrant white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the wet season. Its rhizomatous growth pattern allows it to spread rapidly along the forest floor, forming dense mats. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its humid, shaded habitat.
